actions.name: Divine Sense
actions.snippet: As an action, you can detect good and evil. Until the end of your next turn, you can sense anything affected by the hallow spell or know the location of any celestial, fiend, undead within 60 ft. that is not behind total cover. You can use this feature 4 times per long rest.

actions.name: Lay on Hands Pool
actions.snippet: You have a pool of healing power that can restore 10 HP per long rest. As an action, you can touch a creature to restore any number of HP remaining in the pool, or 5 HP to either cure a disease or neutralize a poison affecting the creature.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike

actions.name: Protection
actions.snippet: While wielding a shield and a creature you can see attacks a target other than you within 5 ft., you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

racialTraits.snippet: You gain a breath weapon and damage resistance with your chosen dragon type.

Each creature in the area must make a DC 9 saving throw (type determined by your ancestry), taking 2d6 ([6th] 3d6, [11th] 4d6, [16th] 5d6) on a failed save, and half damage on a successful one.

characteristics.faith: Tymora, Godess of luck and good fortune

traits.bonds: Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again.
traits.flaws: I have a “tell” that reveals when I’m lying.
traits.ideals: People. I’m loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
traits.personalityTraits:
I would rather make a new friend than a new enemy.
I am always calm, no matter what the situation. I never raise my voice or let my emotions control me.

actions.name: Arcane Recovery
actions.snippet: Once per day when you finish a short rest, you can choose expended spell slots to recover - up to a combined level of 1, and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

actions.name: Sculpt Spells
actions.snippet: When you cast an evocation spell that affects other creatures that you can see, you can choose a number of them equal to 1 + the spell’s level. The chosen creatures automatically succeed on their saving throws against the spell, and they take no damage if they would normally take half damage on a successful save.

features.name: Spellcasting

racialTraits.name: Darkvision
racialTraits.snippet: You can see in darkness (shades of gray) up to 60 ft.

racialTraits.name: Keen Senses
racialTraits.snippet: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

racialTraits.name: Fey Ancestry
racialTraits.snippet: You have advantage on saves against being charmed, and magic can’t put you to sleep.

racialTraits.name: Trance
racialTraits.snippet: You don't need to sleep, but meditate semiconsciously for 4 hours a day. While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

racialTraits.name: Elf Weapon Training
racialTraits.snippet: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

racialTraits.name: Cantrip
racialTraits.snippet: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. INT is your spellcasting ability for it.

racialTraits.name: Extra Language
racialTraits.snippet: You can speak, read, and write one extra language of your choice.

name: Maurice

traits.bonds: I’ve been searching my whole life for the answer to a certain question.
traits.flaws: Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
traits.ideals: Beauty. What is beautiful points us beyond itself toward what is true. (Good)
traits.personalityTraits:
There’s nothing I like more than a good mystery.
I’m used to helping out those who aren’t as smart as I am, and I patiently explain anything and everything to others.

attacks.name: Longbow
attacks.notes: Martial, Ammunition, Heavy, Range, Two-Handed, Range (150/600)

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.snippet: You can punch, kick, head-butt, or use a similar forceful blow and deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1 + STR modifier

features.name: Favored Enemy
features.snippet: You have advantage on Survival checks to track your favored enemies, as well as on INT checks to recall information about them. You also learn one language of your choice that is spoken by your favored enemies, if they speak one at all.

options.name: Humanoids
options.snippet: Humanoids are the main peoples of the world, both civilized and savage, including humans and a tremendous variety of other species.

features.name: Natural Explorer
features.snippet: You have a favored terrain type. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for proficient skills when you make an INT or WIS check related to it. While traveling for an hour or more in your chosen terrain, difficult terrain doesn’t slow your group’s travel, your group can’t become lost except by magical means, you remain alert to danger even when you are engaged in another activity, you can move stealthily at a normal pace (while alone), you find twice as much food while foraging, and while tracking creatures, you learn the exact number, sizes, and how long ago they passed through the area.

options.name: Coast
options.snippet: You are particularly familiar with one type of natural environment and are adept at traveling and surviving in such regions.

features.name: Fighting Style
features.snippet: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty.

options.name: Archery
options.snippet: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.

features.name: Spellcasting
features.snippet: You can cast known ranger spells using WIS as your spellcasting modifier (Spell DC 13, Spell Attack +5).

racialTraits.name: Languages
racialTraits.snippet: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language.

notes.backstory:
I been told me story is like to bring common folk to tears when I tell 
it, but it's really a merry tale full of life and long lived--pass me 
the wineskin--where to begin? 

Ah grew up on the banks of Bonny 
Bay where the salt breeze sweeps over grassy rocks in the Northern sea. 
Cold nights and icy mornings, the kind that make a fellow snore as his 
nostrils freeze over. But warm sun and all the fruits of the sea. Bonny 
Bay may look a bit desolate, I grant yeh, but the deeps of the sea are 
worth more acres o'farmland than I've ever seen with me two eyes. 



Ah grew up playing on the rocks-pop never made much doing patchwork on the ships and ma ran as a washer at the Galvan tavern, the nice establishment, you see. We made enough to keep a couple rooms on the waterfront, but we were never the money in the town. That was fer the sailor kids, especially the navy sons, right royal bastards for the most part, but they weren't all the same, that's true. Grew up learning lots of the languages from them, little bits an' pieces here and there. Comes in handy dockside, I tell ya, what with everyone speakin' a different tongue. Ah was what they might've called a pond-wader, makin' a couple bronzes on pulling up mollusks during the days an' selling em dockside. Rock snailswere most common, then pygmy zebra snails, the little one's with the striped shells, good fer eating if you've got a stove that can get up the heat, though you've got to have a lot of em. If I got to go out on the scows, which weren't often, ah pulled up Northern oysters and barnacles (meat's better than you think it is). Here ah go talking snails again. Point bein, ah learned how to cook snails. 


Took up a job as a kitchen boy at the Smelly Nickle, the not-so-nice tavern in Bonny Bay, but knew how to cook snails and caught on right fast to fish. Mostly they brought up cod, bu' also tuna an' shark an' monkfish, sometimes mackerel and marlin if ye were lucky. Ah got to the point where I got to be cook... ah suppose it's not much of a story, ask me about it an' I'll tell ye all the foreign fish foods ah learned to make. Got em all tucked away upstairs, even now. 



Well, the ships were comin' more an' more often, and bringin' in less an' less each time. I didnae think much of it in the beginning, but now ah look back and think, we should have seen it comin'. Soon, nae one fish could be caught in Bonny Bay, an' just like that, all the ships found a different berth. Bonny Bay used to be a treasure; now, it's just a desert. 


I took off after that. Me ma and pa were well gone, an' I never much settled down with naebody, so I 'ad places to go. I went South, sailin' along the coast, until I found water full of life again. That's the kinds of places ah live now. An, if I see those ships haulin' tons of fish into the port towns, let's just say those ships find a way to sink, if ye follow me. Don't be takin' more than ye need, or y'll make an enemy out of me an' mine.
notes.otherNotes:
Encyclopedic Knowledge of Marine Invertebrates
Pretty solid knowledge of most ocean fish
notes.personalPossessions:
Naturalist's Book Full of drawings of plants and animals encountered along the coasts
A nickel (it smells a bit odd, actually)

traits.flaws:
Flaky 

Impulsive
A deeply felt, but usually untapped, fury and hatred for any who destroy their environment
A deeply felt, but usually untapped, fury and hatred for any who messes with a person's livelihood
traits.ideals:
Don't take more than you need
Never get into a brawl you canny get out of
A leaky ship is a ship worth leaving
If you canny live off a tide pool, yer nae worth yer salt.
Sea breezes make happy people
traits.personalityTraits:
Good Humored
Talkative
Pedantic where mollusks are concerned
Somewhat lazy (prefers a sit, a fire, and a warm conversation)
Flighty

actions.snippet: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack with a finesse or ranged weapon if you have advantage on the attack roll. You don’t need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 ft. of it, that enemy isn’t incapacitated, and you don’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

notes.backstory: Squangdangle was once the kingpin of the local crime syndicate. However, he was dethroned by his best friend and right hand man- Remmy Shitticus. He'll now do everything in his power to reclaim his old position.
notes.enemies:
Remy Shitticus
Clerics - They think I come from a line of sin
Overly Lawful Characters
notes.personalPossessions: A coin with strange writing on it.

traits.bonds: Something important was taken from me, and I aim to steal it back.
traits.flaws:
If there’s a plan, I’ll forget it. If I don’t forget it, I’ll ignore it.
I'm incredibly racist against Gnomes.
traits.ideals:
People. I’m loyal to my friends, not to any ideals, and everyone else can take a trip down the Styx for all I care. (Neutral)
Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them. (Chaotic)
traits.personalityTraits:
I don’t pay attention to the risks in a situation. Never tell me the odds.
The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can’t do it.

name: Crankus

traits.bonds: I work to preserve a library, university, scriptorium, or monastery.
traits.flaws:
Most people scream and run when they see a demon. I stop and take notes on its anatomy.
I speak without really thinking through my words, invariably insulting others.
traits.ideals:
Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
Knowledge. The path to power and self-improvement is through knowledge. (Neutral)
traits.personalityTraits:
I’ve read every book in the world’s greatest libraries—or I like to boast that I have.
I … speak … slowly … when talking … to idiots, … which … almost … everyone … is … compared … to me.
